_main.prompt: Nation general description with details on location and divisions. With other prominent/notable general details?

Geography.prompt: What is the overall geography? Any notable locations?

Climate.prompt: What does the climate look like? Rain/Temperature/Snow/Tides/Wind/Radiation/... Is it changing? Are there recurrent climate events (tornadoes,volcanoes,floods,...)? Are there different climate regions?

Biodiversity.prompt: How diversity is the fauna and flora? Are they under treat? Were any drove to extinction? Relation with agriculture/industry/infrastructure? Are habitats preserved? Is there education? Is there zoos/botanical parks/forests/sanctuaries/national parks/...?

Natural Resources.prompt: What resources are present within? Is there scarcity or surplus?

History.prompt: What are some notable historical events? Colonization/Independence/Indigenous people/Expansion/Conquest/Regime Changes/Coups/...

Evolution.prompt:
How old is your nation?
Do they have common ancestors? If so, are they extinct? Are they equal in development? 
Where on the planet did your nation originate?
Was there any outside influence to their evolution?
Were they divinely created?

War and Conflict.prompt:
Have there been any wars?
What have been the common attributes to the starting of wars?
Have other Nations been destroyed or subjugated?

Migration.prompt:
Does your nation migrate across the planet? If so, what determines this migration? Is migration Seasonal, Cultural, Spiritual?
Are they Sedentary (Stay in one place)?

Disasters.prompt:
What disasters has your nation experienced?
Were there any extinction level events?
Was there an Apocalypse?

Stories & Myths.prompt:
What stories are frequently told?
What stories are used to shape the youth?
What myths shape the culture? (for example to reinforce their skepticism or war like behaviour)
What key events occurred?

Government.prompt:
How large is the government? How influential is it? How is it viewed by the populace? How is it viewed by nobility/oligarchs/...?
How does your nation govern themselves?
Is there a central government? If so, who is in charge? How are they appointed?
Does this government allow anyone to govern?
Do people pay their government in taxes, in labour, in crops, in military service? 
How is succession determined?
Is there an heir apparent (either actual or political)?
What happens if the heir is a child?

Politics.prompt:
Who has the right to levy taxes?
How are the people with the power to give orders chosen?
Who provides support services for the head of state and what are they called (examples: councilors, ministers, secretaries, viziers)?
Who is responsible for protecting the head-of-state?
What safeguards does the head-of-state have against assassins, poison, assault, and magical attack?
Are any activities licensed or certified (driving, dog ownership, being an attorney or a physician)? 
Who does the certification or licensing? 
Is it merely formal (pay a fee, and get a license), or are there qualifications to meet?
Can licenses or certifications be revoked, and if so, how?
How much influence do special interest groups (such as merchants, wizards, or religious sects) have on politics?
 What political positions are considered conservative?
What political positions are considered liberal? 
Are there political positions that are unthinkable?
Does your nation have a constitution? If so, what does this constitution contain?
What rights does your nation have? Are some rights reserved for certain members of society?
Is there any form of free expression, freedom of speech, freedom of movement, etc?
Are there political parties? What are the major political factions at present? How long have the current political factions been around?

Law and Judicial System.prompt:
What are considered normal and legal ways of gathering evidence and determining guilt?
Are torture and magic part of the legal system?
Are arbitrary judgements by a lord or landowner allowed, or is there a standard that they are supposed to follow? 
Is there an appeal system?
Is everyone tried in the same courts or are there special courts for special classes of people — for example, are mages tried in specialized wizard’s court?
 Are there separate courts for civil and criminal matters? Magical and non-magical matters? Of nation and outsiders? Religious matters?
What things are considered truly serious crimes and why?
What are the punishments for serious versus minor crimes?
Are there prisons, or are people punished and released?
Are there degrees of punishment such as fines, branding, public whippings, removal of body parts, executions — or do they just hang everybody regardless of the crime?
Who is responsible for catching criminals?
Are there independent precincts, overlapping districts, or separate jurisdictions?
Can law enforcement be hired?
Are there lawyers or advocates?
Who can afford legal representation? 
Are people guilty until proven innocent, innocent until proven guilty, or does it depend on the mood the bench is in when the case comes in front of it?
Are there assumptions made about how an accused criminals will be treated?
Are there judges other than the nobles or gentry?
Is mob justice common? Is it legal?
How is mob justice viewed by society? 
Are highwaymen, muggers, bandits, or pirates common or rare?
What sorts of crimes would the average citizen be likely encounter in their lifetime?
Who can make or repeal laws?
Are there laws forbidding certain types of people (peasants, wizards, priests, women) from carrying arms?
Are there laws requiring certain people to be skilled with certain weapons?
Are certain spells (as opposed to magic generally) illegal?
How would a criminal magician be detected? Apprehended? Punished?

Public Services.prompt:
What services does the government or head-of-state provide?
Are schools, wells, courts, and the army paid for by taxes?
What services do people expect from their government?

Civil Organisations.prompt:
Are there worker unions, civil rights groups, etc?
How are these groups regarded by the governing authority?
Are protests common? Can revolutions occur?

Foreign Relations.prompt:
What are the relationships with other nations like? What is the current and historical foreign stance?
Are there multiple governments on your world? If so, how do they interact?
Is there a global council of world governments?
How do nations communicate with each other?
Which nations have formal relations with other countries?
Who can be ambassadors and envoys?
Are there standing embassies and consulates, or are envoys sent only when something specific comes up?
How are treaties arranged?
Are there any significant ones currently in force or coming up for signing?
How much do official attitudes toward other countries affect commerce and trade?
Do merchants pretty much ignore tensions between governments as long as they can make a profit, or will this get them into trouble?
How much formal spying and intelligence gathering is normally done by governments?
How much spying is done by the military?
Do merchants (or companies) engage in espionage?
Who has the best information gathering system?
Which countries are traditional allies?
Which countries are traditional rivals?
How do these traditional alliances and rivalries affect foreign policy?
Which heads-of-state are related by blood or marriage?
How important are political marriages?
How do ties of blood and marriage affect foreign policy?

Administrative Divisions.prompt: How is the government divided? Who controls what? Is control tied with family/age/popularity/knowledge/...? What are some regional divisions and their administrative structure?

Military.prompt: How well known is it? How well funded? How powerful and intimidating? How does morale influence the military?

Structure.prompt: How structure is the military? Are there special forces? Are there air/sea/land/... divisions? Are there units and divisions? Who control those? The chain of command? Are militias used and how often?

Weapons and Tactics.prompt:
What weapons are used? What armor is used? What equipment is used? What tactics are used? What vehicles or siege weapons are used? Are divisions based on weapons?
How are these weapons made?
Who are allowed to carry these weapons?
Does your nation wear armour? If so, what is it made from? How much of their body does it cover? How effective is it against different attacks?
How does your nation defend its cities?
Are there armies? If so, how are soldiers recruited? Is there a form of draft, military service, etc?
Who in in command of the army? What is the chain of command?
Are there mercenary groups/militias?

Rules of Engagement.prompt:
Does your nation have specific tactics?
Can your nation show mercy? Do they take prisoners?
Are unarmed civilians considered fair-game?
Is total destruction a standard military action?

Conflicts.prompt:
What are some previous and/or current conflicts/wars? With whom? Why?
Has there been any recent wars? Who won?
Are there ongoing tensions from the most recent war?

Alliances and Treaties.prompt:
What are some previous and/or current alliances/treaties? With whom? Why? How important are those?
Is there a form of oath keeping? Bannermen, Blood debts, honour-bound, etc?
What alliances are there in your world? Who are they in these alliances?
Are there smaller factions within these Alliances? If so, Is there political intrigue?

Economy.prompt: Is the economy developed? Is it a relevant/prominent topic? What sectors are most relevant? How has it developed historically? Any event of relevance (like an industrial revolution or innovation or discovery)?

Taxation.prompt: Is there taxation? How does it work? How is it received?

Financial Organisations.prompt:
Are there banks? If so, do they provide loans, bookkeeping, Worker pensions etc?
Is there a centralised banking system or are they independent?
Is there any form of financial regulation? Is Cronyism standard practice?

Currency.prompt: Is there a local currency? Is it physical? What do the coins look like? Are there notes? What is it made of? Is it based on another currency? Is it standardized?

Trade and Transport.prompt:
How does trade work? Is it a barter system? Is there international trade? How does transportation of goods work? By what means does it work? Are there trade organizations and/or regulations? Is there a class that dedicates itself to trade?
Has your nation invented the wheel?
Does your nation have motorised transport? If so, what fuels them?
Are animals used as a form of transport?
Are there aircraft? If so, what do they looks like? How do they function?
Is sailing a form of transport that your nation uses?
Are there magical means of transportation?
How available is water transportation?
How common is travel? How dangerous is travel?
Does the concept of travelling just “to see the world” or for fun even exist?
Are there good roads?

Tourism.prompt: Is there tourism? How prolific is it? What areas/locations are often visited? Is there religious/educational/eco/scientific/creative/seasonal tourism? Is tourism domestic or more widespread?

Agriculture and Industry.prompt:
Is there a prominent agriculture field? What is cultivated? What livestock is used and for what? Is rotation/pesticides/genetic modification/selective breeding/... used? Is there water issues? Is there an active industrial sector? What is produced? Who is the workforce? Are there safety/monetary/environment/investment problems? Has your nation domesticated any animals? For food, materials, protection, etc?
Does your nation have pets? If so, what animals are considered pets?
Are there animal livestock?
Does your nation have consumerism/commercialisation?
Can your nation own businesses? Are there consumer franchises?
Is there industry in your world? Are there factories?
How much power are corporations allowed to have? Are there mega-corporations that control nations/planets?

Imports and Exports.prompt: What goods are exchanged? Is there any well known regional/national products? Are there restrictions? Are there tariffs/licenses/quotas/barriers? Are there controlling organizations/bodies? Is there smuggling ans is it a problem? What policies are relevant?

Science and Technology.prompt: Are there prominent science and/or technological fields? How is science conducted and by who? Are there policies/grants/investment/research related to science and technology? How does tech influence daily affairs? Is there any famous innovations or innovators?

Science.prompt:
Does your nation use science?
Does your nation use Mathematics? If so, what number base do they use?
Does your nation use Chemistry, Computing, Robotics, etc?
Are there unique subjects of science that your nation has developed?
How much is known about the laws of nature, physics, and magic?
How much of what is commonly known is factually wrong?

Units of Measurement.prompt:
How does your nation measure Length, Distance, Weight, Time, etc?
How does it compare with other systems like Meters, Inches, Miles, etc?
How are these units determined? Are they standardised?

Tools.prompt:
What types of tools does your nation use?
Are there special/unique tools? If so, what do these tools look like? How are they used?
Are these tools manual or powered? If they are powered, what fuels their power?
In what areas might magic replace technology?

Medicine & Surgery.prompt:
What types of Medicine does your nation use? Herbal, Synthetic, Chemical?
Does your nation practice Surgery? Is it part of a centralised healthcare system, or performed by independent doctors/healers?
Can your nation modify their bodies using cybernetic prosthetics? Are there any limitations linked to them? Cumbersome power supply, Body rejection, Social stigma?
Who are the healers? Do you have to have a talent to heal? Who can become a healer?
Who trains healers, herbalists, apothecaries, surgeons, magical and non-magical?
How available are such services to ordinary people?
How much is known about anatomy, physiology, pathology, psychology, and so on?
Are treatments based on purely practical experience, or do healers understand at least some of what they are doing?
Is healing generally a magical process?
What kinds of treatments are available and how effective are they?

Birth.prompt:
Is there a reliable method of birth control?
Who normally handles births?
What is the maternal mortality rate? The infant mortality rate?

Death.prompt:
Is it possible to resurrect or resuscitate someone who has died?
If revival is possible, how long is it before it becomes impossible, or before serious brain damage sets in?

Insanity.prompt:
How is insanity treated?
Are there asylums or treatment centres?
How effective are treatments for insanity?

Communication.prompt:
How are messages sent when necessary?
Is there a public or private postal system, or does everyone of importance have to send messengers?
Are there magical means of communication? How common and reliable are they? How expensive?
How do people find out what is happening in the world?

Timekeeping.prompt:
How is time kept?
What units are time kept in? Hours, Minutes, or something else?
Is there a specific device for keeping time? Clock, Candle, Sundial, etc?
Are there different methods of timekeeping across different world cultures?

Infrastructure.prompt: How good and maintained is the infrastructure? Are there big projects underway or already existent? How is infrastructure development distributed to various areas?

Cities and Urbanization.prompt: Is the nation generally urbanized? What does the infrastructure look like? What are common features in cities?

Building Materials.prompt:
What does your nation make their buildings out of?
What common materials does your nation have access to?
Are there any materials that your nation cannot use/make?

Rural.prompt: How different are rural areas? Is there a class division? Are they poorer/less infrastructure?

Nature.prompt: How is nature treated? Are there environmental concerns?

Society.prompt: How relevant is Society and unity? Are social rules strictly defined or generally accepted?

Demographics.prompt: Is there a population boom? Is there an age problem (too many young or too many old or a tendency towards either? How is gender structured? Is there a disproportionate distribution?

Class System.prompt:
Is there a class system in your society? If so, what style is this system?
Is there a form of discrimination or segregation? If so, how is it justified?
Does this system allow for class movement? Can the lower class become upper class?

Education.prompt:
What is the state of the education? Are people literate? Are people educated? Is there a social gap? Is there higher education?
Does your nation have an organised education system? If so, at what age does your nation enter this system?
Does this system bestow any form of status? Is education considered a privilege, a right, or something to avoid?

Health.prompt: What is the state of the health and healthcare? Are people healthy? Is there a social gap?

Values & Ethics.prompt:
What does your nation consider fundamentally important? Family, Freedom, Peace, Education, etc?
What does your nation consider Right or Wrong?
Do your nation have Charity?
What is their opinion on Killing/Accidental Death?
Are acts such as Lying, Cheating, Fraud deemed acceptable?
Is there slavery?

Religion.prompt:
What religions are practiced? Are there official religions? Are there oppressed religions?
Views on Afterlife, Heaven & Hell, Origin of the Soul, Burial, Superstitions and Genesis & Creation?

Languages.prompt: What languages are spoken? Are there official languages? Are there minority languages?

Citizenship.prompt: Is it given at birth? Can you have it by descent? Can you have multiple? Can you have naturalization, when?

Punishment.prompt: Is punishment always lawful? Is there public punishment? Are matters treat in family or in group?

Minority Groups.prompt: Are there minority groups? Do they have representation? Are they oppressed? How are they viewed?

Migration.prompt: Is there an influx of people going in and/or out? Are there migration problems? Are people leaving?

Beauty Standards.prompt:
What does your nation regard as beautiful?
Does your nation use cosmetics?
Does society have any expectations in regards to beauty/appearance? Are these expectations related to Age, Gender, Class, etc?
Does clothing and jewellery relate to beauty?

Relationships.prompt:
How is sexual orientation defined?
Can your nation have friends? If so, how do they make friends? Who can be their friends?
How does your nation acquire a mate?
Are there any intricacies to courting?
How is marriage viewed? Does it exist? Is it expected?
Are they free to match with one another or is matching made by an authority (for example family)?
When do individuals become adults? Is there a rite of passage?

Family.prompt: What part does family play in society? Is there a relation to power based on family? Is marriage expected? Is interracial relations/intimacy frowned upon? How does family tie in with parenthood? How is parenthood/household/family responsibilities divided? Is divorce allowed or badly viewed? Who raises children?

Gender Roles.prompt:
Are there separate attitudes regarding gender?
Do sons/daughters get married off?
Who is regarded as the prime parent?
Are there particular jobs/activities reserved for only one gender?
Do extra benefits get granted to one particular gender?

Etiquette.prompt:
Does your nation have a particular attitude towards eating? Do servants eat last? Do they make a toast or pray before eating?
Does your nation eat their meals in a specific order?
Are there standard greetings and farewells?
Are certain gestures considered rude?
Are there common salutations? Sir, Madam, Master, etc?

Clothing and Apparel.prompt:
What does your nation commonly wear? Are there different items of clothing?
Do different styles of clothing have specific meanings? Wedding dresses, Priest's vestments, etc?

Jewellery and Tattoos.prompt:
Does your nation wear jewellery? If so, where do they commonly wear them?
Do tattoos/body paint have specific cultural significance?
How is the jewellery made? What is it made from? Does jewellery correlate with social class?

Cooking & Brewing.prompt:
What types of culinary practises does your nation have?
Does your nation produce Alcohol? Is the Prohibition?
What unique recipes does your nation have?

Narcotics.prompt:
Does your nation have any form of drugs? Are these drugs a problem in their society?
What are the effects? Are they recreational or harmful?
Is there a social stigma attached to its use?
Are drugs used as a combat aid? Do these drugs enhance any abilities?

Art and Culture.prompt: Cultural Influences, Cultural Divides, Historical Relation and Cultural Outline

Arts and Literature.prompt: How is art reflected in society? Are there patrons? Are there any movements? Relevance in education? Skill and craft? What are its influences? Is art accompanied in other facets of society?

Philosophy.prompt: Importance of philosophy? Is it practiced? Are there specific philosopher or those that practice have other occupations? Are there patrons? Which philosophical types are embraced? Underground movements?

Music and Dance.prompt: Influences? Common instruments, genres and dance styles? Any regional/national symbols? Roles of pitch/melody/harmony/rhythm/texture/timbre/expression/form? In Education? Reflection of society (like music created from dark times or from a happy outlook)?

Architecture.prompt: What does the tradition architecture look like? Is it widespread or with regional differences? What are its influences? Historical? Neighbors? Does architecture extend to public facilities/parks/landscape/interior/disaster prevention/water integration?

Ethics.prompt: Is there a prevailing concept of right and wrong behaviour? Are there ethics in medicine/war/politics/animal/tech/science/business?

Food and Cuisine.prompt: What are some typical foods? What are some common ingredients? Is food shaped by culture/history/neighbors? Is it shaped by current or historical wars/famines/poverty? Condiments/Spice/Meals/Meal Structure/Drinks/Alcohol/Narcotics/Sweets/Salt/Nutrition/Obesity?

Media.prompt: Is media access widespread? In what forms? Do people hear of nacional news? And world news? Is media controlled/censored/altered/propagandized/blocked? What is the level of trust in media?

Sports.prompt: What sports are practiced? How widespread are these? Any interconnection with other places? Are these socially divided? Does everyone play? Do children have rough versions of these (like cloth balls)?

Holidays and Festivals.prompt: Often celebrated holidays and festival? Cultural importance of these? Seasonal? Religious? Historical? Reenactments? Arts?

Society View.prompt:
How do various religions view magic? Do any require or forbid priests to practise magic?
Is Magic outlawed or viewed skeptically?
Are there legal limits to the use of magic?
Are magical users praised?
Is magical pursuit an oddity?
Do some positions require that their holder be a wizard?
How has the presence of magic and magicians affected law and government?

Source of all Magic.prompt:
Where does the Magical energy originate? Is it a natural phenomenon?
Is Magic infinite or a finite resource? Does it get weaker the more it is used?
Can all members of your nation use magic? Is Magic dependant on intelligence?

Magic Archetypes.prompt:
Are there multiple forms of Magic? Fire, Ice, Light, Dark, etc?
Are there different institutions for different archetypes of Magic? Schools/Colleges, Arcane University, etc?

Magic Applications.prompt:
Does Magic replace/override Technology? Are the two interchangeable?
Is Magic the preferred method of healing and/or combat?
Are there any restrictions put in place for Magic use? If so, who enforces these restrictions?
